text: Defenders of the Faith is the ninth studio album by British heavy metal band Judas Priest. Defenders of the Faith was released on January 4, 1984. The album featured the singles "Freewheel Burning", "Some Heads Are Gonna Roll" and "Love Bites". The song "Eat Me Alive" was listed #3 on the Parents Music Resource Center's "Filthy Fifteen" which is a list of 15 songs the organization finds most objectionable. The co-founder Tipper Gore said that the song was about oral sex at gunpoint. In response to the allegations, the band recorded the song "Parental Guidance" on their next album Turbo. ==Songs== ==References== Category:1984 albums Category:Judas Priest albums
title: Defenders of the Faith
